snippet: 3rd Ward, a haven for artists, craftspeople and other creative types, left many angry stakeholders in its wake after crippling financial losses forced its closure last month.
abstract: Arts center and creative network known as 3rd Ward, housed in former warehouse in Bushwick, Brooklyn, was first and seemingly most successful of arts-and-entrepreneurship meccas springing in gentrifying parts of borough; start-up's financial collapse has dashed hopes of stakeholders, many of whom paid thousands for lifetime unlimited memberships that co-founder Jason Goodman now says are not refundable.
lead_paragraph: 3rd Ward, a haven for artists, craftspeople and other creative types, left many angry stakeholders in its wake after crippling financial losses forced its closure last month.

headline.main: At Once-Promising Brooklyn Arts Center, Creative Hopes Are Dashed
headline.print_headline: At Once-Promising Brooklyn Arts Center, Dashed Hopes
